channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New AI battle: White House vs. Anthropic
item.description: The White House and Anthropic , maker of the Claude chatbot, are in a war of words over AI regulation. Why it matters: AI may be the century's most co...

item.title: Scoop: Dems plot Fetterman ouster
item.description: Top Democrats in Pennsylvania are maneuvering to run against Sen. John Fetterman in a 2028 primary contest, threatening to tear the party apart in the...

item.title: U.S. forges ahead on Gaza deal amid disputes, clashes and executions
item.description: The Trump administration is working to help establish a multinational security force for Gaza, vet potential Palestinian civilian leaders, and take th...

item.title: CEOs grow a bit more apprehensive as tariff uncertainty weighs
item.description: Data: The Conference Board and The Business Council; Chart: Axios Visuals A key measure of CEO confidence dipped slightly lower into negative territor...

item.title: AI industry bets on its own trillion-dollar growth
item.description: The AI boom is built on a series of bets that the logic of exponential growth will drive the future. How it works : Exponential doesn't just mean "num...

item.title: U.S. revoked at least six visas over Kirk comments, State Department says
item.description: “The United States has no obligation to host foreigners who wish death on Americans,” it said, adding that it continues to identify visa holders who h...

item.title: GOP congressman says Capitol Police is investigating swastika in his office
item.description: Rep. Dave Taylor’s office called the appearance of an American flag with a swastika on it “vile vandalism.” An image of the flag taken from a virtual ...

item.title: Trump wants a White House ballroom. These companies are funding it.
item.description: Tech, crypto and defense companies are among the donors that have committed millions to help turn Trump’s ballroom dream into a reality, according to ...

item.title: U.S. pushes Russia to negotiate as Hegseth warns Moscow of ‘costs’
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is pushing for Tomahawk missiles as the Trump administration tries to prod Russia into talks on ending the war.

item.title: Supreme Court seems open to limiting key section of Voting Rights Act
item.description: Further limits on the use of race in drawing electoral districts could have a major impact on representation in Congress and legislatures.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
